JUDGES: Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , Mr Petro Ivanovych Baloga , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE village , GPE region , GPE .
CARDINAL . At the material time , the applicant was a district police officer .

CARDINAL . On DATE the local prosecutor 's office instituted criminal proceedings against the applicant , charging him with abuse of authority and forgery . It was alleged , in particular , that during DATE the applicant had drawn up a number of reports of administrative offences and forged the signatures of imaginary offenders in order to embellish his work statistics . However , the offenders mentioned therein did not exist .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( hereinafter referred to as “ the ORG ” ) found that the acts imputed to the applicant had ceased to be a danger to society . Accordingly , it ruled that he was no longer liable and discontinued the proceedings against him . The applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( hereinafter referred to as “ the Court of Appeal ” ) quashed the decision of DATE , having noted that the lower court had not verified whether the applicant had consented to the discontinuation of the proceedings against him , and that it had examined the case in the applicant 's absence . It ruled , however , to discontinue the proceedings against the applicant . According to the applicant 's submissions he was not provided with a copy of that decision in due time and this therefore caused delays in appealing in cassation against it .
CARDINAL . From DATE to CARDINAL DATE no hearings were held .

CARDINAL . On DATE , having allowed the applicant 's appeal in cassation , ORG found that , contrary to the requirement of the law , the courts in both instances had examined the case in the applicant 's absence and that they had discontinued the proceedings against him without his consent . Accordingly , it quashed the ruling of DATE and remitted the case for fresh consideration to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE and ordered a retrial .
CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the court hearings were adjourned owing to the applicant 's failure to attend them . The applicant asserted in this regard that he had not been duly summoned .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the police to secure the applicant 's attendance at the next court hearing . According to the applicant , he was brought to the hearing on DATE .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , on DATE , he was again brought by the police to ORG . However , he alleges that this was without a proper court order .
CARDINAL . According to the ORG 's submissions , the applicant failed to appear on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the applicant guilty of abuse of authority and forgery but amnestied him .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , pointing out a number of shortcomings of the lower court ( for example , the failure to indicate in the judgment the punishment given to the applicant , the failure to indicate the date of the amnesty act referred to , the failure to resolve the matter of court fees ) , quashed the judgment of DATE and ordered a retrial .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed in cassation . On DATE ORG rejected his request for leave to appeal .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on CARDINAL and DATE the applicant failed to appear . Owing to the applicant 's failure to comply with the court summons , ORG ordered the police to secure the applicant 's attendance at the court hearing . According to the applicant , these orders were enforced on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the applicant guilty of the aforesaid crimes and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . The court also banned the applicant from holding positions in the organs of ORG . By the same judgment the court amnestied the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's appeal in cassation . However , it ruled that the applicant should be exempted from punishment because the statutory time - limit for prosecuting him had elapsed .
CARDINAL . According to the records provided by the Government the adjournments due to the applicant 's failure to appear caused a delay of DATE .
